H0.text: What is the traditional name of the woven tape used in dressmaking or millinery for stiffening fabric. Grosgrain

H1.text: What is the traditional name of the woven tape used in dressmaking or millinery for stiffening fabric. Staytape

H2.text: What is the traditional name of the woven tape used in dressmaking or millinery for stiffening fabric. Interfacing

H3.text: What is the traditional name of the woven tape used in dressmaking or millinery for stiffening fabric. Petersham

A4.text: Interfacing is a textile used on the unseen or 'wrong' side of fabrics to make an area of a garment more rigid.

A5.text: Interfacings can be used to stiffen or add body to fabric, such as the interfacing used in shirt collars and cuffs.
